question.title: How to direct Java GC logs to Java Logger?
question.body:
I have a Java server running on Google's Cloud-Run with garbage-collection logging enabled via

        "-Xlog:gc",
        "-Xlog:gc*=info,heap*=debug,safepoint=info",
        "-XX:NativeMemoryTracking=summary",
        "-XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions",
        "-XX:+PrintNMTStatistics",

When the server is run locally or inside a local container, I can see the GC messages appear on the console. But when I run it in Google's environment, those log messages do not go to the logging server.

My app does its logging via the slf4j library via something like this:

logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger("com.mydomain")
logger.info("foo!")

The logback.xml configuration has this:

    <appender name="cloud" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
        <encoder class="net.logstash.logback.encoder.LogstashEncoder">
        </encoder>
        <log>backend</log>
        <flushLevel>WARN</flushLevel>
        <filter class="ch.qos.logback.classic.filter.ThresholdFilter">
            <level>INFO</level>
        </filter>
    </appender>

How can I get the GC log messages to take the same route as the app's internal logging?
